name: The SDAP Question
description: With the Netherlands entering a new socio-political order, the time has come to consider whether to allow the somewhat centrist SDAP to stand for election to the assembly that will decide the nation's future. It may be a Trojan Horse for reactionaries.

name: Elect a New Assembly
description: We must choose who to elect to our new legislative body in order to establish a new constitutional framework for Holland.

name: The Third National Assembly
description: The time has come. The Assembly will decide on who fills each post within the new executive Volksraad, allowing all left-wing parties to have a say in this new political order.

name: One Raadspensionaris!
description: Unexpectedly, the majority of the Assembly appears to have come to one simple conclusion. There should only be a single 'Grand Pensionary', David Wijnkoop, who shall guard the revolution against reactionaries and imperialists without a shred of mercy.

name: Council of the State
description: The Council-Communists under Anton Pannekoek and his KAPN have taken a majority in the new Assembly, becoming the leading constituents of the Volksraad executive body. Known for their opposition to formal decision-making bodies, this has come as quite a shock.

name: Vakbondsfederatie
description: The Assembly's majority choice appeared to be the syndicalist NAS party under Harm Kolthek, who has called for Communard-style rule under a 'federation of trade unions'. The most 'orthodox' of the serious leftist groups in the state, the NAS was a clear compromise between all involved.

name: Socialist Republic
description: Henk Sneevliet's radical socialist RSAP party has been elected with a majority by the Assembly as the new government. A new socialist republic is likely to be formed, with less of the overt posturing of the hard-left syndicalists and reactionary-style backsliding of the SDAP.

name: Social Democracy
description: Shocking many of those present in the Assembly, it appears that the Volksraad elected was indeed that of the moderate SDAP under Willem Albard. It appears that, for the other more militant factions of the revolution, allowing the SDAP to take part in the elections proved to be a serious mistake.

name: The People's Army
description: The revolution did not transpire just so it could be derailed by vested interests and imperialists within our own armed forces. Serious reforms must be undertaken if we are to purge it of dangerous malefactors and preserve the Commune.

name: Union of the Military
description: While it is perhaps not ideal that much of our armed forces remain unrepentant capitalists and reactionaries, we must work with what we have. Dutchmen, both left and right, must work together for the good of our country.

name: Dutch Militias
description: The way forward for our armed forces is the recruitment of People's Militias to help us safeguard the revolution and prevent foreign forces from crushing us before we have managed to find our feet.

name: Army Reform
description: With the new order secured in both the Assembly and the Volksraad, we must turn our gaze to the armed forces. Recent political turbulence has left them poorly trained and understaffed. We must rectify this immediately.

name: Suppress Reactionary Ideas
description: The revolution is far from assured. At every turn there is another threat that must be systematically eliminated in order to preserve what we have so far accomplished. It begins with the most obvious dangers, including peoples of German descent.

name: Ban Capitalist Thoughts!
description: While we have taken care of more obvious threats to the revolution, there exists a lower level, more imperceptible danger to the nation. While small, even simple thoughts and whispers about markets and democracy risk subverting our people's movement.

name: Labour Camps
description: Our political and ideological foes can learn peace through labour, by soldiering for the revolution in the mines and in the camps. There, disarmed, they can pose little threat to us and can reflect on their flawed beliefs and acts.

name: Democratic Workplaces
description: All workers must have a say in the company for which they slave. No longer shall employers and reactionaries oppress those that toil for them - without representation at least.

name: Mass Collectivisation
description: A key part of our economic doctrine is the collectivisation of agriculture and industry, lumping smaller entities under a larger and more efficient centre.

name: Verzorgingsstaat
description: The least we owe our people is a well-managed and properly functioning Welfare State, one that is palatable to both socialists and conservatives alike.

name: Union Liberty Constitution
description: Formalising the new political order of our nation with a formal constitution would alleviate the concerns of many, more conservative Dutchmen as well as legitimise our executive in its new role.

name: Market Syndicalism
description: Just because there is a new leftist order in Holland doesn't mean that we should cast aside all of our old trappings. After all, the markets incentivise workers in many fields, including construction.

name: Embargo German Trade
description: For too long the bastion of imperialism to our east has posed an existential threat to all that is good and righteous in this world. Germany's efforts to smother the working class wherever it exists mean continuing trade with would be absurd.

name: Spreading the Revolution
description: As a syndicalist nation in Europe it is vital that we play our part in the struggle for the working class. To do otherwise would be a gross dereliction of our duty.

name: Tolerate German Trade
description: For many the idea of accepting the new reality of socialist rule meant sending our nation on a collision cause with the behemoth that is the Kaiserreich. The government however, has decided that continued relations with Germany only serve to benefit our nation.

name: Batavian Neutrality
description: There are some in our government advocating conflict against capitalists and imperialists, but many more now propose in secret a new policy - nicknamed simply 'Batavian Neutrality'. This entails merely continuing our prior neutrality with a new socialist gloss.

name: Finish the National Assembly
description: With a number of substantial reforms instigated and proposals outlined, the Assembly now appears to be drawing to a relative close, its primary purpose served. It has been invaluable in drawing our new socio-political system together and so its legacy will live on.

name: Batavian Committee of Science
description: By nationalising the assets of research companies and placing them under the oversight of one committee by, for and with the people, we will be able to conduct research far more efficiently.
